description:
8 years I have been searching for a good curry in the States. 8 bloody years!!! 

Being from England the curry here has always been disappointing. Not this place. Leaving with a massive smile on my face because the curry was banging. Oh and accompanied by a nice big cold larger. 

Heaven.
author: Henri P.

description:
Based off what I ordered, the food here is tasty but doesn't cater to homestyle Indian taste. The curry portions were pretty small. 

- Chicken Tikka masala - too creamy I would not reccomend this. 
- Chana Saag - really tasty but chickpeas were overcooked
- Muligitawney soup - had either too much coconut milk or cream, oily, taste of Dal didn't come through
- Tandoori Chicken - came out on a sizzling platter and was nicely cooked but the marinade left a lot to be desired 
- Service - excellent!
author: Anjali P.

description:
This update is in response to Mr.Ajay's reply to my review-
First of all please Google or find out from restauranteurs in India what a"Thali" is- your justification is -when I order Gulab jamun and you bring rasmali and say that every restaurant has its own menu and food.
No! There are some things which are standard and you need to stick to what they are when you are naming them.What you served was a Three course meal and not a Thali.
And to the point where you said we questioned only when the bill came up,of course we were taken aback to see 85$ for 2 Thalis which would have normally costed us less than 50$.And in the beginning when we were given 4 samosas the server told us that 2 Thalis were a lot of food,then I immediately told we will cancel one and he said no you cannot as we already brought the samosas!(if he would have cancelled then, all this chaos wouldn't have happened)
So the whole situation arose because you used a Standard item Thali and made it into whatever you want.You are free to do it but it's your responsibility to explain it to your customers and not think that it's a headache to the servers.
You wasted our time,money and we left your restaurant completely disappointed with your hospitality.
author: Ramya R.

description:
I stayed out a little too late on Friday. So when I woke up, I was starving. Decided to get delivery through Eat24 on Saturday, September 22nd. I placed my lunch order at 2:45pm. It arrived at 3:45pm. I live in Outer Richmond.

*Samosa: Homemade crispy Indian pastry stuffed with spiced peas and potatoes, Served with homemade mint chutney, hot and sour and tamarind chutney, All batters are signature chickpea (garbanzo batter) prepared by our chef ($4.95)
*Chicken Momo: Nepali delicacy cooked with ground chicken and Himalayan spices filled in cover with thin flour dough and steamed ($8.95)
*Chicken Tikka Masala: Roasted chicken breast cooked in creamy tomato and onion sauce, Extra spicy ($12.95)
*Garlic Naan: Naan layered with freshly minced garlic and chopped cilantro ($2.95)
*Serrano Chili Naan: Naan brushed with blended green chili ($2.95)

I adored the curry. It was creamy and comforting. Could have used a little more spice as I wanted it extra spicy, but it had a good amount of heat. The naan were both soft with a nice chew. Though, I do think they could have used more garlic and chili. The flavors weren't strong enough for me. The samosas were good. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Though their mint chutney was very bland and watery. Didn't really stick to the samosas. I love dumplings so the momos were tasty. The dipping sauce complemented them well.

Indian is my comfort food and this hit the spot. Especially since I was feeling a little delicate that day.
author: Elena N.

description: The korma and masala are heavenly, and the service felt warm and personal compared to last year.  We stopped in for an early dinner last weekend and were immediately seated. We got an unexpected free serving of excellent papadum and chutneys to start the meal. The vegetable korma and vegetable tikka masala were both amazingly flavorful, full to the brim with vegetables, and not too heavy. I would also recommend getting the kabuli naan because the sweetness of the cherries baked into the naan complements the creamy sauces perfectly, and all of the naan portions are enormous. The food was so good that we ate every last bite even though we weren't very hungry! We're looking forward to our next visit.
author: Vijay N.

description: I'll start with saying that I have only ordered takeout from this restaurant. I should probably dine in at some point but their takeout is just so dang good and easy. My staples are the chicken tikka masala which has a nice rich flavor, perfect over their basmati rice. Samosas are packed full of goodness. And the garlic naan, oh my, the stuff dreams are made of!
author: Ashley G.

description:
Craving for Indian food? This is an amazing restaurant: heads up: they don't have buffers !! I was surprised too since I've rarely seen an Indian restaurant without a buffet.

We ordered roti, butter naan and butter chicken, the gravy was amazinggg!! Creamy and delicious!! The quantity was enough for 2 people. The roti bread was good food, and with prompt servers, I had no complains whatsoever.

Great food,  wish the restaurant was a bit bigger in size, but I didn't have to wait so no complains :)
author: Saarthak C.

description:
If you crave that spice fix you can only get from authentic Indian food, this is the place! My favorites are chicken tikka masala (spicy), garlic naan, lamb chops, and of course, chicken momos. 

Also very fragrant and flavorful- the chicken biryani, Shrimp tikka masala (spicy), and the seekh kabobs. 

Everything tastes a little bit better spicy, as hot as you can eat it, and followed by a delicious mango lassi.

The ambiance is very nice and comfortable. The service is really great.
author: K C.

description:
Oh sjit!!! Thus spaketh the dude who ordered, when he opened his to go platter.

This freaking spot actually lives up to its name..

Order the veggie momo nice spicy flavor

But the aforementioned exclamation and subsequent explanation came from the awe provoking lamb shank.

This mofo was like the size of mr T.'s bicep!!  No baby ill equipped veal box baby here!!!

Felt like a dog gone sultan eating this prized specimen..  

True royalty while eating on my drive down Fillmore Street in my Chrysler minivan... 

A+ guys. Job well done. Excellent portions. Flavor, freshness... And hooked me up with extra naan!
author: Dubl A.

description:
Ate here last year with 2 friends.

Food: The food was so so good - some of the best Indian food I've had in the city at reasonable prices!

Atmosphere: Comfortable, clean, and they have a decent location. Note, the dining area receives a lot of cooking scents from the kitchen, so we left with our clothes smelling strongly of spices, so just be prepared!

Service: The service was great - fast, nice and knowledgeable!

Would give this 4.5
author: Michelle B.

description: VEGETARIANS AVOID THIS PLACE! We ordered kadai paneer but got chicken pieces along with paneer. When we asked them to check, first they mentioned it should be paneer but we requested them to check with chef and they confirmed it was chicken indeed and then mentioned it is "No problem" for them and can prepare a new one. It may be no problem but its a big deal for vegetarians. We left the place immediately. Horrible experience
author: Pray D.

description:
I was in a particularly zen mood when I entered this familiar Indian restaurant because I just came out of a low and slow afternoon at the Kabuki Springs & Spa down the block. After all, it was men-only Monday, so I was au naturale in the hot bath but fortunately not at this restaurant. No, I was fully clothed and feeling quite serene in here, even though I recall taking advantage of their busy all-you-can-eat buffet more than a decade back, probably stuffing my gullet with chewy naan and saucy korma. Those gluttonous days are gone (fingers crossed), and I decided to keep it light, at least as light as my head was feeling. A complimentary flat of papadum arrived on my table with three flavorful dipping sauces (photo: http://bit.ly/2iL45vC).

Just wished there was more papadum. From there, I started my true order with the $4.95 Cucumber Tomato Salad, a simple and small plate of freshness with tomato slices covered fort-like by cucumber slices lightly seasoned with chat masala and accompanied by a vinegary dipping sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/2kl1Y1N). For my entree, I ordered an old veggie favorite, the $10.95 Baigan Bharta, clay oven-roasted eggplant cooked into a stew-like consistency with green peas & spices in an onion & tomato gravy (photo: http://bit.ly/2BwU6O9). Quite hearty and tasty with plenty of umami flavor and complemented nicely by the $2.95 dish of Basmati Rice (photo: http://bit.ly/2AoBGSr). So I did manage to keep things light and maintain my sense of calm. Ummmmmmm.

FOOD - 4 stars...a surprisingly refreshing Indian vegan meal
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...the space looks more open than it did before
SERVICE - 4 stars...efficient & polite
TOTAL - 4 stars...a fine post-bath meal if Dosa is packed
author: Ed U.

description:
Ordered dal makhni and bread. Not even close to my expectations. Not properly cooked, bland 

I'm disappointed. Will not recommend this place and especially this dal.
author: Cyber B.

description: I eat here probably more than I should. This isn't a place for really spicy Indian dishes, it's more for creamy, indulgent flavors. I love it. If I'm extra hungry at first I'll get the veggie momo's which are excellent. I've gotten their saag paneer, paneer tikka masala, vegetable korma, and malai kofta. Everything has been excellent. Great spot for vegetarians!
author: Shelby B.

description: This was the best indian cuisine i ever had.Food was so delicious service was so good.The guys outfront were really friendly and the service was so good.It was an amazing experience for us as we flew from La and were looking for a good indian food.This place is really good and very friendly atmosphere.
author: Sudeep B.

description:
Delicious food! We ordered the baigan bhartha, shahi paneer, and malai kofta. Everything was very well seasoned, and just as spicy as we asked for. I especially recommend the malai kofta. They all had a little too much cream, but that's to be expected from restaurant food. The downside is naan or rice are not included with the entrees, so you have to order them separately. I ordered a serrano chili naan, which I really loved and recommend.

We came during lunch time on a Sunday, and it was pretty busy. Turns out, this place is owned by the same people who run Om Indian Cuisine in Haight-Ashbury, and they just opened another restaurant as well. The ambience is alright, a little dark (I think Om does a better job here). Service was also a little slow. They brought out our three different appetizers one at a time, perhaps in order to buy time for the entrees, which came a good 25 minutes after the order was placed. However, it was well worth the wait, and, overall, made for a great meal.
author: Apoorva A.

description: We ordered through Ubereats  and it took forever for the driver to deliver the food to us. We had called the restaurant so many times to ask about the status and the guy over the phone was extremely helpful and the good part is we found out that they do free home delivery . Now lets talk about food. OMG  food over here is amazing. We got seekh kebab and salmon vindaloo with some rice and naan. The spices were right on point but however I do think that they should give some complimentary rice with curries.
author: Vimpy G.

description:
After the delivery guy left and I peeked into the bag, I frowned when I saw the jumble of containers and a cup of Mango Lassi nearly overturned. The mango lassi was a bit warm, too. 

My grumpiness immediately dissipated when I popped open the trays and the fragrant aroma of spices and grilled meats perfumed my kitchen.

And everything was really delicious, juicy and perfectly cooked. 

We ordered two appetizers, Chicken 65 (pieces of yogurt-marinated, seasoned crispy chicken breast,  $9.95) and Chicken Momo (steamed/pan-fried Nepalese chicken dumplings, $8.95). Both were solid but didn't bowl me over.

Tandoori Mixed Grill ($18.95) entree was truly delicious with tikka and boti kebabs and tandoori chicken and salmon. The grilled onions pulled all the proteins and flavors together. 

Plain basmati rice and garlic naan ($2.95 each) rounded out the meal.

That I have to nitpick shows you everything was delicious. Suggestions would be including a small container of plain yogurt (especially if you order more heat) and to slice the salmon bigger in the Mixed Grill plate because it looked identical to the pieces of chicken. When I found it, I was too full to try it. 

Plenty of leftovers means there's enough for two full meals tomorrow, no skimping necessary. 

And PS...That was the best mango lassi I've ever tasted.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
This place is good if you are not looking for aunthetic indian flavor. Their flavors are good but medium spicy is too mild and if you order spicy- god help you finish it. They add tons of red chilli flakes if you order spicy food. We have given it many chances, tried to explain that we would like medium spicy food but it never turned out to be what we wanted. 
If you are not looking for certain spice level curries- you might like this place
author: Grishma Z.

description:
Wow. What a hidden gem! Reasonable prices and very generous portions. 

Came on a Saturday night by myself. Place was pretty full when I arrived at 7 and was packed with a wait by 7:30.  

First of all, I ordered vegetable pakoras. Usually you get like three or four. I got a total of nine tasty, well seasoned fritters. More than I could manage by myself so I saved some for later. They were perfectly battered and fried fritters of strips of what I think were mainly potato and zucchini. Nicely salted too. 

For my main I ordered mattar paneer which is always a favorite. While I prefer not to be asked for a spice level because dishes should just have a level, i liked that when the server asked for a spice level and I asked her to recommend one, she actually thought about before saying medium. She also recommended rice over naan when she asked me that question. The naan was more than the rice, too. 

It took a while for my main course to arrive which tells me it probably was not  just sitting in a cauldron but was actually cooked. It arrived piping hot, with a ton of peas and really big chunks of cheese. Yum. For "medium" it wasn't that spicy but the flavor was really good. 

I'll definitely be back. There's a huge selection of vegetarian dishes. I'm not vegetarian but enjoy eating well done vegetarian food. Five stars for that here.
author: Tim P.

description:
Do I miss the old restaurant? Sure I did,  but my husband and I love the new. The feel is great and the service is wonderful! 

The food was excellently prepared, the seasoning was just right on EVERYTHING and it was just an as around God experience. 

One star off only because my fruit naan didn't have all the fruits it said did. (Sad face)
author: Milan F.

description:
The food is fantastic here. Everything is fresh, the spices are intense and pungent, and the sauces are velvety. 
We visited twice while on our vacation, and had two very different experiences. We went the first time early afternoon just after the lunch rush and the service was attentive. The second time we visited for dinner and the service was pretty bad. We waited almost an hour for food and when we finally got it they had my hungry five-year-olds order incorrect. I ended up giving him my food and having to eat what they brought since there was no way we could wait longer for them to remedy it. All in all though, the food is so good that I can't even take a star away for the poor service on the second visit.
author: Marcie K.

description:
3.5 Stars.

Service was great and there were some in-house appetizers. This is one of the most upscale Indian restaurants I've ever eaten at but I'm not surprised since it's around the Lower PacHeights area. The food was decent but I'm not sure I can justify the price for the quality of the food. The curry I had was in medium spicy and IT WAS ON FIRE. And mind you, I've done the fire noodles challenge 2x in my life (on a tangent but there are tons of videos on this challenge on Youtube). Anyway, I also love MALA dishes, so it's safe to say that I have a high tolerance for spicy food. This medium spicy curry will sure make you sweat...or swear. 

The food was good but not something that wow'ed me, for some reason the wow-factor wasn't there. The chicken was ok, but it wasn't extraordinary. Same for the naan. The basmati rice was a better in quality compared to other places but I'm not really here for the rice.
author: Denise L.

description: My absolute favorite food to order-in in the city. The portions are generous for the price and the flavors are exceptionally good. Food is always fresh and tasty. My go-to order is the chicken tikka masala and the salmon tandoori. Both are amazing!
author: Nicole D.

description: We went here for dinner on a Sunday. There was no wait and got a table right away. The food was great- portions were big and flavorful! I got chicken vindaloo with garlic naan and my friends got chicken tikka masala, butter chicken masala, chicken korma. They were all delicious!
author: Theresa H.

description:
After a long day running around for my birthday,  hubby and I decided to stay at the hotel and order delivery for my birthday dinner.

After endlessly pouring over yelp reviews for the best restaurants in the area, we settled on two choices and dug into the reviews for each. 

This restaurant had far fewer reviews, but most were highly complimentary,  so we decided to take a chance. We were so glad we did!

We ordered the butter tikki chicken (spicy) and the chicken vindaloo (very spicy). We also ordered some samso.

So before I talk about the food, let me be a Debby  downer.  My issues which prevent this from being a five star review are that 1. The order took 25 minutes after the quoted delivery time, which was already an hour from the time I placed the order. 2. No silverware was provided, but thankfully we were able to get some from the hotel staff. Umm, it's a delivery...provide some cutlery!! 3. Since it took so long for the food to arrive, it was not as temperature hot as I prefer and we couldn't warm up our food,  so we had to eat it as delivered. 

So the food. OMG,  it was FANTASTIC! We love love Indian food and this seriously could be the BEST Indian food we've ever eaten. The spice level was accurate and we definitely got mouthful of heat and perfect spiciness. 

The garlic naan was good, and the rice was perfectly cooked. If our delivery was this good, I'm sure it would be the same in the restaurant. 

Overall great experience and we can't wait to eat here again!
author: Crystal L.

description:
Sweet intimate feel and we scored the table by a window. Very nice people and very good food. We had the vegan coconut curry vegetable and they made the dahl mahkani vegan, using coconut milk. Not outstanding but really good and we thoroughly enjoyed the feel of the place. "Medium" price was a bit not spicy so I would order it spicy next time. And then see what happens!

Next time we'll try the chicken or vegetable Momo which is a Himalayan dish. FYI their chai comes already lightly sweetened with sugar.
author: Genie O.

description: Food is quite delicious. The saag paneer was super, and the Bharta was the best, tasted homestyle. Would definitely come again. Price reasonable for the food given.
author: Maria G.

description: Great food and service.  I had lunch here friday and ordered to nataraj veg korma normally i wouldn't eat all of it but it was so good i ate it all, love this place and i'll be back.
author: Kent P.

description: Showed up 30 minutes later than promised. Tasted terrible. My tikka masala tasted exactly like tomato cream pasta sauce. Biriani was soggy and lacked flavor. Rogan josh was bland and watery. Naan was kind of ok I guess? Basically no redeeming features of this meal.
author: Laura B.

description:
Very good, traditional Indian food. Royal Indian is not "fusion" like other Indian restaurants in the neighborhood, but it is slightly higher scale than most.

Unlike their completion, down the block, they do not teas you with papadum and then charge extra for chutney. They don't charge an additional "SF Mandate" fee. It's included in the cost of their food. Their wine list is not huge, but their wines are fairly priced. Food is tasty. Service is very good and you can tell that they're wait staff are really making an effort.

The restaurant has a diverse clientele so I wish their spread of "spicy, medium" or "mild," designations for how you want your food, reflected the spectrum of their clientele. We are Indians who have lived I. The US for most of our lives and we felt that their "spicy" was not spicy enough. Otherwise, Royal Indian was bang on.
author: Tushar N.

description: To add to my previous review: also love the Lamb rogan josh.
author: JJ M.

description:
I miss the very affordable AYCE place it once used to be, but I LOVE this new place. All the food we ordered came out hot, seasoned to perfection, and reasonably portioned. My husband and I ordered the following:

Tandoori Assorted (chicken, lamb, grilled veggies) - $10.95
Tandoori Chicken Wings - $9.95
Kashmiri Chicken - $11.95
Garlic Naan - $2.95
Tandoori Roti - $2.00
Chai - $4.00

Cannot go wrong with any of the above. Our favorite was the Kashmiri Chicken. It is a sweet, creamy, and rich chicken curry dish. The chicken was buttery soft. The curry could be spicier though.
author: Jenn H.

description: Some of the best samosas I've ever had. The Tikka masala is clutch. I'm a wimp about spice and the medium Daal was fine. Definitely a favorite spot.
author: Adrienne N.

description: We didn't have any entrees here but the Tandoori Chicken Wings were the best chicken wings I've ever tasted. Masala chai was super good too. Can't wait to come back for dinner!
author: Shevawn T.

description:
Ive been coming here for Lamb shank it's so good 
I also have tried other stuff which was good
author: Mohammad Z.

description:
What a gem! When you're feeling tired of hitting up all the trendy SF restaurants in Hayes, the mission, and nopa, come here for some truly excellent, well prepared Indian food. Many Indian food restaurants in America make the food overly rich, but not Royal Indian! I've ordered several entrees ranging from vegetarian to chicken to lamb. All of them were perfectly seasoned, the meat was always very succulent. I can't handle a lot of spice and they prepared the food to my tolerance level without sacrificing flavor. 

On top of the fabulous food, the prices are reasonable and the ambiance is nice.
author: Michelle B.

description: Amazing quality of meat, sauce and fine attention to detail.  We really enjoyed the atmosphere as well.  We will definitely be back!
author: Julian K.

description: Meh. Second time ordering food via delivery. Got the tandoori chicken, lamb vindaloo and garlic Nan. Delivery experience was fine. Food is pretty bland, sauces are watery and meat is dry. Tandoori chicken tasted mostly like tomatoes. Garlic nan is ok, but again not well seasoned.
author: Bill L.

description: Fairly priced and very filling! There aren't very many restaurants left on Fillmore that can cost about $35 for dinner for 2. When you sit down, you get a really yummy sort of spiced cracker and dipping sauces. The entrees look really small when you order them, but about 2 entrees and a side is definitely more than enough for two adults! The servers are really friendly too and it's nice to still have a place like this in the neighborhood.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Apparently under new management and slightly remodeled, this place has improved slightly from the previous owners.  We had a hankering for some Indian food after work and remembered this spot out in the Fillmore.  No buffet options anymore either.  

Although they were busy, there was an table available for us and didn't have to wait.  We decided to go with the Thali special for 2:  STARTER: Pappadum, Samosa ENTREES: Chicken Tikka Masala, Saag Paneer, Tandoori Chicken with Boti, Side of Rice & Naan. DESSERT: Kheer.  Such a steal for a little over $40.  

My favorite dish was the tandoori which was perfectly spiced and came out sizzling on a hot plate.  The naan also stood out as the texture was spot on.  The not so greats?  The saag paneer was quite plain and the tikka masala was also slightly bland.  Were they terrible?  No, but I've definitely had better.

I have to say that the portions were huge though.  We definitely needed doggie bags and had dinner for the next night.  

Service was slow but they were efficient.  3.5 stars and a good option for Indian food in the area.
author: Jen W.

description:
I don't know Indian cuisine that well and I've only had a few dishes here but this is a place that I will keep coming to because it's so damn tasty and I plan on working my way through the whole menu. The chicken vindaloo is so flavorful and just enough heat. Tonight I had the tandoori chicken and again, very flavorful. I thought I hated rice but the jeera rice was like something I want with every meal now but I can't make it so I guess I'll just have to keep eating here. 

The ambiance is casual and the service has always been great. Also it's pretty cheap for SF. I had the tandoori chicken, rice, laccha paratha, and a glass of wine which set me back $29 for meal and $6 for tip. Btw, I have enough leftovers for another meal and snack.
author: Juliette H.

description:
Couldn't even get anybody to acknowledge that we were there waiting for a table. Finally got seated after 45 minutes and bigger groups that showed up much later being seated. Took another 45 minutes after we ordered to get our food. 

Asked for a chair so we could sit facing each instead of on the same bench, and they simply  said "no", when there were plenty of extra chairs. Menu is way too big. Apparently the sizzling meat plates are the thing to order. They did smell really good, and the curries were at best mediocre. 

I would be tempted to go back now that i know what to order, but the service was so bad all the way through. There's really no point.
author: Grem W.

description: Yum! Cute little place had lots of patrons on a Saturday but no wait. Service and food was prompt and super tasty. Great selection on the menu, will have to be back to try some more options. Good prices.
author: Kaitlin S.

description:
I rarely if ever give bad reviews. So I will clarify here. There food is good but the delivery system is bad. I ordered food two nights in a row. The first day, the food was delivered on time at the room (motel) & the delivery man got his tip from us. 

The second night, the delivery guy called up 5 minutes before reaching and asked me to collect the food from the street. It MAY be linked to me having paid the tip online.

Then, on opening the food containers, we realized that the order was mixed up.  And basically, the chicken dish was missing. I tried calling twice but wasn't any use.


So, to summarize. Good food.

Bad delivery system. So you guys should either eat in, or find some place else to deliver. RAAVI is better and professionally managed.
author: T D.

description:
Lamb shank was so undercooked that it was hard to chew soi we left our. The tomato sauce was clearly just added to the cooked lamb shank right before they served it. Basmati rice was also not cooked well. Chicken tandoori, we asked for dark meat only and our waiter confirmed the order but still we got breast pieces and thigh. They are audio loading like 1.5 pounds of onion on top of this tandoori to make it look like a large dish. You don't fool anyone.
Waiter forgot to bring us Jeera rice. Then instead of bringing it, he said he will go check if we ordered it. 

We last more that half of what we ordered on the table and asked for check. The waiter did not even ask why the lamb shank was untouched and most of the 3 orders of basmati rice was not eaten. 

To those San Francisco folks who think this is awesome Indian food, you have not had good Indian food. Go eat at Amber at least. Or go 3 doors down and eat at Dosa.
author: Nariman R.

description: My favorite Indian place in SF! Never a wait and food is always SOO good!!!
author: Ayaka S.

description:
I was disappointed.  It's been hard to find good Indian food in my neck of the woods and I was hoping this could be it based on all the reviews. Unfortunately we did not like 2 out of 3 of the main dishes and could not be bothered to finish them. 

I give it 2.5 stars but because the main dishes were so disappointing, I'm rounding down. For $55 for the meal, I  expect better. 

Delivery took a long time (1hr 20min), which was predicted by the ordering app, so I do not take off any stars for that. 

We ordered 6 things:
1) Saag Paneer, medium spice - this was good, I'd give it 4.5 Stars 
2) Chicken Tikka Masala, spicy - the chicken was incredibly dry and tasteless and the sauce was thin and milky lacking the thickness and depth of taste I expect. 2 Stars
3) chicken Vindaloo, extra spicy - incredibly watery, very disappointing. 1.5 Stars
4) garlic Naan, good, not amazing. 3.5 Stars
5) mango lassi - excellent. 5 Stars
6) basmati rice - average. Like that it had peas. 3.5 Stars 

Portion sizes of the main dishes: below expectations. I would have expected 50% more for what I paid. 
Rice and naan and lassi portion sizes were about right.
author: Hayley J.

description:
Food is great.  The service sucks.  I've been there four times now (after their makeover and shift away from buffet style) and at least three of those times I've received either pushy or forgetful service, and had multiple interactions that made me just feel weird by how the staff acted.  And this does NOT happen most other places with me.  

Tonight my waiter was downright rude when he dropped the check by pushing it under my hand practically so I had to "pay attention" to it and him, and instead of being polite he stared at me and looked down at the check, like pay it now.  Then, as there were two other tables full of people in the restaurant, he came by again after about two minutes and asked if I was ready.  I was not.  Still munching on food. I can't remember exactly what he said but he bordered on aggressive in insisting I need to pay immediately.  Food in my mouth. Still sipping the (warm) water that was just poured in my glass.  I think he said "you are ready".  I replied I was not.  I've just eaten a full meal, not stopping chomping from the second they dropped the food.  And they want me to pay and leave.  With two other tables with multiple people still eating and laughing and chatting.  Not only that, when I arrived there were three empty tables.  One of those a two-top about 4 feet from the front door.  I was offered either the table by the door or a table that hadn't been cleared, but definitely NOT the other two clean, set, and empty tables.  I said I'd like the table away from the door that hadn't been cleared.  In case you missed it, there were two other clean tables empty, mind you.  So I proceeded to wait patiently for what seemed like 10 minutes while the bussman took his sweet time clearing and setting multiple tables.  Not just the table he was asked to set for me by the waiter.  Then as I'm waiting patiently (but starting to get frustrated at how distracted the bussman seems to be already) a group arrives and the bussman stops setting my table and starts getting water, menus, and whatever else for this new group, while a waiter stands there and chats.  The whole time there are three other waiters not taking orders but rather talking amongst themselves or to the new group that has arrived. Finally the man I presume was the bartender or something comes over and asks if I've been helped. I mention that I was waiting for said table but the bussman seemed to be distracted attending to other things.    The waiter came by and must have heard of my comment to bartender and mentioned that they were tired, "twelve hour shift, you know" and did apologize for the wait.  This did make me feel better.  But it makes me think, maybe you shouldn't all work twelve hour shifts!  I've been in fine dining service and I can't imagine ever being asked to work from noon to midnight, or whatever.

To continue in this forgetful/slow fashion, the papadam arrived ten minutes after I sat down and two minutes before my meal was served.  And I'm pretty sure the stack of three papadam was not for me but for the full table behind me, as I saw the same man walk back a minute later with a shorter stack of papadam for them. Not a big deal, but also not good service. 

Then after being served and eating non-stop I get the downright rude check drop and subsequent aggressive attitude with the check.

Just left me feeling crappy leaving there, again.  And I walked in very relaxed and happy.  I thought I'd give them another chance.  But it seems they just don't get the fine(r) dining that the have shifted to, since their makeover (and new ownership?)

Yuk.
author: Bill s.

description: Amazing deals and lots of food! I came with my friend and my girlfriend, who has hitherto experienced decent Indian food. Everything from the texture and taste of the curry to the naan is made with science and art. The royal thali special is great to share for two, but even with three people we had a tough time finishing all the food. The deal is definitely worth it if you like the popular Indian hits (saag paneer, tikka masala, tandoori). Great service too - definitely worth the shot, and happy to say everyone at my table was glad they came to eat here. Be wary of the food induced coma that will likely follow any meal here.
author: David Y.

description:
We came in expecting the previous restaurant--Indian buffet. This was great though. Apparently, it was day 2 of their grand opening. 

Food = great. Clean. 

Complimentary papadum = great. Fresh, hot and full of flavor. 

Chicken tikka masala = good. Great flavor, white meat chicken, creamy and slightly sweet. He loved it. 

Basmati rice = okay. 

Service = friendly. Attentive.

Prices = moderate. 

We'll be back for a return visit.
author: Fannie S.

description:
First thing that attracted me is the name then the ambience while coming to the main stream of any particular restaurant is "FOOD" because,with out great flavour or the special essence the ambience or the name doesn't make any magic....
Amazed by their hospitality and the food tastes beyond awesome,small place with great taste love it.

1. Chicken tikka kebab smoking hot.
2. Delicious creamy Chicken tikka masala.
3. Crispy crispy Onion kulcha and garlic naan.
4. Mango kulfi.
Amazing lunch under 50$.

I wish you guys all the very best.
author: Phani C.

description: We came here with empty stomachs. We shared samosa, rice, and garlic naan. I ordered chicken korma, my brother ordered shrimp tikka masala. The samosa was great: clean and not salty but perfectly spiced. The naan was great but I thought it could've been crispier, perhaps I was just biased since my goto Indian place in NYC had really crispy (yet soft inside) naan. The chicken korma was definitely solid, but I thought it could've been a little thicker. The portion was pretty small as well - too small for 1 serving of naan. The service was good. If I live here I'd visit this place on a regular basis.
author: Karl S.

description:
My favorite Indian restaurant EVER. Usually I don't have Indian food more than once a month. Now I go here weekly!  Everything I've had is delicious but my personal favorite (as a pescatarian) is the salmon tandoori. The menu has something for everyone including a whole page for naan options- Yum!!

They also sell wine which is abnormal for an Indian restaurant except for the super premium places. This isn't dirt cheap but you get a nicer ambience and the option for booze. They also do delivery but some dishes I would say are best hot!  Speaking of hot they accommodate mild for those of us with weaker taste buds. 

For two people including a bottle of wine and usually enough leftovers for lunch the next day it's still less than $100 after tax and tip.
author: Z C.

description: I love their shrimp tikka masala!  Full of flavor!  Not to mention the texture of the shrimp is perfect with the luscious texture of the tikka sauce.  Service is great and I will definitely recommend this to family and friends.  Of course, I have a favorite spot now for Indian food!
author: Hazel B.

description: Great chicken tikka. The mild option is not spicy at all. Suggest medium hot if you like it a little spicy.
author: Casey A.

description: Delicious! The butter chicken is sweet, the naan was chewy and delicious. Love the chicken momo! Great flavors all around.
author: Hannah S.

description: This is a wonderful restaurant. The service is exemplary and the food delicious and more than beautiful in looks and taste. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal.
author: Ashleigh D.

description: I was greeted promptly. The service staff was polite and responsive. The chicken tikka marsala was superb. The entire staff was very attentive...this is a classy restaurant among area restaurant that are not.
author: David S.

description:
I was really pleased with delivery from this restaurant. It came quickly and was still warm.
We ordered the 
"Royal Thali Special for 2: Starter: pappadum, samosa. Entrees: chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, tandoori chicken with boti, side of rice and naan. Dessert: kheer" for $42. 

We got four meals out of it! The entrees didn't have very much protein in them, but to be fair it was supposed to be for two meals. The naan came a little tough but I bet if we had it fresh at the restaurant it would have been better. It also came with a variety of dipping sauces which were fun to try and all tasty.

This was a fun way to try out multiple dishes from a new restaurant at a great price.
author: Emma B.

description: Don't be fooled, there are better Indian restaurants anywhere else. I walked in after a couple. I was greeted with a side eye because they were going to close in 25mins. Then after I sat, another couple walked in and the host/waitress gave them a bad time for walking in as a paying customer. The fresh flowers on the table was great. The hair in my chutney and the fries fries in my pakoras was not great at all!! The only place they earned two stars from was the Vegan coconut curry with vegetables. Other than that, it's a spot that I would never return to again.
author: Nisha G.

description: The vegetarian food was good but the non vegetarian varieties we tried were average. Good service. Loved the mango lassi here out of all the Indian places I tried in the Bay Area.
author: Pavani P.

description:
One of my favorite Indian food places to order delivery from.
I always find myself craving their Daal soup & the Baigan Bharta. While I've never eaten in, the inside of the restaurant looks nice and cozy, with white linen covered tables. Good dinner option for a night out on Filmore St at a more affordable price point than DOSA down the block. I appreciate the fact that they have a good variety of vegan/vegetarian options, also when they mean spicy, they mean SPICY (Thank you) :D
author: Daniella O.

description: Had it delivered. Hot and delicious! Mango lassi chilled and sealed well. Yum!
author: Ivy P.

description:
Stopped in for a quick meal after reading the amazing Yelp reviews! Overall a great experience!

FOOD: I had the veggies momos as my appetizer. They were fairly underwhelming taste-wise, but the presentation was very cool. I've never had vegetarian monos before so it's possible that they were good, but I just don't like veggie momos. 

My main was Paneer Tikka Masala with white rice and chili naan. It was awesome! Highly recommend! 
The naan was presented very well and was buttery and flakey. The Paneer was thick and creamy. 

SERVICE: My waiter was attentive and very accommodating. No complaints here. 

AMBIANCE: The ambiance was pretty neutral. Basic Indian restaurant, nothing fancy but far from dingy.

I would definitely come back to try some of their vegan fare!
author: Premlata P.

description: I loved the use of seasoning and spice at this restaurant.  I went with an Indian friend from Silicon Valley, so she did not think it was as great as I thought, but I thought it was very good, close to Indian you'd have in London, U.K. vs. California in general.  I will be back again.
author: Masako T.

description: I ordered the vegan coconut curry veggies, and OMG. So delicious!! Creamy and light at the same time. Garlic naan is also yummy. I highly recommend!!
author: Tiffany S.

description: If you are looking for a restaurant with traditional and delicious Indian​ food this is THE place! Cozy (not fancy) environment and great price as well. Totally recommend​.
author: Bruna S.

description: Same old average, non-authentic indian food that you get pretty much all across the US. I ordered the chicken korma and butter chicken with garlic naan. Chicken korma was better than the butter chicken but again, it is nowhere close to what you would get in Shalimar, which is not very far from this place. I didn't try the kebabs but I am pretty sure I didn't miss anything. If you're looking for a restaurant which serves kebabs cooked in a proper tandoor and have a nice char on them, or tandoori naans which are crisp on the outside and soft on the inside, then this is not the place. Go to shalimar instead :)
author: Akshat G.

description: Great flavor, variety of options on the menu and everything we ordered was delicious!  I found it hard to find truly good tasting Indian food in this area and this will be my go to place!  I loved it!  The samosas were flavorful and not oily.  The chicken kebabs were my favorite!
author: D R.

description: I have eaten here several times by myself and with my wife and each time have had a pleasurable experience: prompt and polite service, nice ambiance, delicious dishes and reasonable prices. They will customize the amount of spiciness you want and get it right. This is my new Go To place for Indian cuisine.
author: Michael B.

description: Their korma is one of the best I've ever had. I'm super excited about returning and eating a billion more dishes.
author: Saphyre R.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! Best Indian in town! The naan is delicious and the tikka masala is amazing.
author: Fernanda D.

description: This restaurant is a little tacky but kind of in the best way. The waiter is in a suit and there is candlelight. I got the chicken tikka Marsala, garlic naan, and chicken mo mo. It was okay but not great. Very light flavor but good texture.
author: Tina L.

description: Some of the best Indian food that I've had. We ordered vegetable momo, butter naan, chicken tikka masala, coconut vegetable curry, and rice (you do have to order rice separately- it does not come with the entrees). Flavors were full and fantastic. Servings were generous.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
There were obviously a lot of fake 5-star reviews for this restaurant, but we tried it anyways.

Delivery was faster than expected. The garlic naan bread was delicious. The aloo gobi had the perfect amount of spices.

However, the chicken tikka masala was bland and the shrimp vindaloo was really watery and also very bland. Hopefully this was just an off night for them.
author: Lester W.

description: Small hidden Indian restaurant with great flavor. Don't get discouraged with the ambiance as it's pretty outdated but the food is well worth it. Went with the recommendations made by the hostess and was well worth it. We ordered the Paneer Tikka Masala and the Navratna Kurma and both were very delicious. The only issue besides the very outdated decor was they had loud music playing in two different languages one in the dining hall and the other coming from the kitchen which was louder which was very annoying. Overall satisfied with the food as that's what we went for.
author: Dev S.

description: We love this place. Wait staff is very friendly and food is great. Fantastic Indian for the price. We have already been here 3 times in the last month and will definitely come back soon.
author: Yasi N.

description: Best Indian restaurant I've EVER eaten at!! Everyone I meet who asks where to eat in San Francisco this is my favorite spot! Most consistent Indian restaurant I've ever been to. Staff is amazing, food is amazing, ambiance is perfect! I'd give 10 stars if I could!
author: Lisa M.

description: Portions were good. I ordered chicken tikka masala (chicken was a little dry), saag paneer (yummy), garlic naan (good), and eggplant fritters (loved the sauce). Overall, experience was okay but not my favorite in the neighborhood.
author: Robyn B.

description:
Just got my postmates order and overall some things were delicious and others I wouldn't order again. I think the order may have been rushed as things could've been better. Examples; no silverware, no sauce for my samosas and no rice! They probably charge extra for it but this was a huge disappointment! How do you eat curry without rice??? 

Anywho...

1. Chicken masala - 4/5 - the chicken was a little tough but the curry was absolutely silky & delicious! 

2. Saag Paneer - 4.5/5 - the cheese was cut into enormous steak-like chunks, they should be bite size. Overall the dish was incredibly tasty! 

3. Samosa - 3/5 - incredibly average samosas. I was really disappointed that they didn't include a sauce with my order. It definitely needed it as they were a little bland and nothing spectacular. Kudos for arriving hot and crispy though. 

4. Garlic Naan - 1/5 - probably the worst naan I've ever had! So disappointed! The dough was super chewy/almost raw, and had a very bitter taste to it. The garlic made it even worse. The whole bread was submerged in bright yellow garlic butter (normally I'm a fan) but it was just soggy. Also the garlic was cut into large raw chunks, and there was tons of it which rendered an even more unappetizing bitter, stringent taste. And this is coming from a garlic fan! Yuck! 

Maybe they are better when you dine in?
author: Tifany M.

description:
I really liked the old place. I mean, it wasn't all that good, and, even though they'd raised their prices, it was still a pretty good deal on the buffet. So, when I saw this new place, I was skeptical, but still willing to give it a try.

The food was delicious. We started with the baingan pakora. It was good for what it was, but I think I'd get the mixed vegetables. Our two entrees were spot on good. They vary the spiciness, but the mild/medium/spicy is still pretty subjective. I thought they did it appropriately - medium hit the range for my wife and me (max comfort for her, just enough to taste for me). We had laccha paratha and butter naan. The paratha was super wheaty, which was fit the bill for whole wheat. The naan was both fluffy *and* crispy.

I went in dehydrated, so I was gulping down water, and the waiter was constantly running over to refill my water right on cue - attentive without hovering.

We'll definitely go back, and might be doing delivery or pick up.
author: masa s.

description: Ate light lunch here during Fillmore Jazz Festival. Usually tough street parking in this area, but today we walked Fillmore area and decided to eat here. Service was very good. Food tasted very good. Nice decor of table cloths, napkins, and flower. Not too crowded today probably due to everyone eating festival food vendor offerings.
author: Clifford W.

description:
I have been to almost every Indian restaurant in S.F. over the last 40 years. I think that I know good Indian food when I taste it. I tasted it at Royal Indian in its new location on Fillmore. First off everything looked fresh and clean. The walls had the same interesting artwork that was in the previous Indian restaurant there. Everything we tried was excellent. The samosas were stunning. The potato stuffing was mashed together with spices and peas, not lumps of potatoes as with some samosas.  The Tikka Chicken Kabob was perfectly done neither dry nor undercooked. The portions were very generous and the prices were very reasonable. 

My one criticism would be that the sweet lassi wasn't sweet enough, but that is easily corrected.

I rate this one of the best Indian restaurants I have ever been to and highly recommend it to anyone who loves to eat.
author: John K.

description:
Photos via yelp; and reviews. Made ordering from here a simple choice, plus extra points for delivery options!!!!
Delivery guy was very kind and called me upon his arrival. Food  was hot, containers were solid and clean. 
Everything was delicious! Check out the lamb vindaloo, fire!!!!!!!!!!
author: Bryan O.

description: Update: downgraded to 1 star because got sick. Old review: Not great not terrible. Food lacked flavor. This is not going to satisfy your craving if you're craving Indian food and you're used to flavor & spi. The people who work there are lovely and it's a nice space, but we won't be going back.
author: Ruth C.

description:
My friend and I were craving some Indian food the other day and looked on Yelp for some inspiration when we found this place! For the appetizer, we had Papadum which is like a thin, crispy, biscuit accompanied with three yummy sauces. What really grabbed my attention was the Garlic Naan. Never really been a fan of naan but this Garlic Naan was sooo fresh and perfectly toasted, I got a little sad when I looked down and realized I had already finished it so quick. We decided to try the Lamb Shank and were so glad we did, thanks to the waiter for the awesome recommendation! It was super tender, moist, and the sauce was absolutely delicious. (10/10 would recommend!) For dessert, we ordered Rice Pudding and it wasn't the jello-like substance I was expecting but it was really good and definitely satisfied my sweet tooth :)

In addition to good quality food and service, the ambiance was also great. Some restaurants either have super loud music playing or obnoxious bright lights, but I noticed that this place had a nice, dim lighting configuration and soft music playing in the background. (Perfect place to bring a date!)

Definitely coming back for round 2.
author: Ashley O.

description: Great Indian spice!  This place is exactly what I expect in delicious ethnic food.  After taking a seat I this quaint restaurant the waiter recommended 2 dishes Chicken Marsala & Lamb something.  Both were medium to heavy spice & we added rice & garlic nan.  I mean, why not!  My 10 yr old & I loved it!  Recommend u stop by soon!  21% tip!
author: Dave S.

description:
Chicken Tikka Kebab: The portion was generous, however the chicken was dry and had no flavor. The menu claimed it is marinated- it clearly had not been.

Baigan Bharta (eggplant curry): Too oily. Did not have peas as promised in the menu. Flavor was OK.

Saag Paneer: Too oily. Good flavor though.

Kabuli Naan: Good flavor, however for $4 it was too small. Other than the pink, shredded coconut, you couldn't taste or see any of the other ingredients it was supposed to have.

Samosas: Crispy and chewy- I think they use a little cornstarch in the dough. Filling was flavorful.

Vegetarian Momos: The filling was unremarkable- some kind of green paste with no defining flavor. The dough was some kind of thin, translucent rice paper or cornstarch mixture- not at all what you expect from momos. The skins dried out almost immediately. They try to mitigate this by brushing them in oil- yuck.

Service was polite and the decor/ambiance pleasant. Would not return for the food though.
author: Gene G.

description:
I noticed this new spot had multiple 5 star reviews and decided to try it out. Noticed some Yelpers were doubting all the positive feedback. This just made me more curious, and hungry! Sometimes you just need to see for yourself. 

Started with a Papadum appetizer, which is like a big cracker with 3 dipping sauces. We also had the Garlic Naan which was so fresh and delicious,....I could eat it all day.

For entrees, I asked the waiter to recommend something with chicken and he suggested the Chicken Chilli, which I had never had before. It was a solid choice and I'd surely get it again.

I was craving lamb so we got the Lamb Shank. It was tender and moist and I loved the flavor of the marinade, it really hit the spot!

For dessert, we had Rice pudding.

***At the end of the meal, we saw another couple had ordered Tandoori. They brought it out on a sizzling platter, filling the place with an intoxicating aroma,....Oh God. Even though I was full, it smelled so good that I vowed to order it when we return, which we will! 

No question, easy 5 stars.
author: Jeff K.

description: Most of the reviews are fake for sure, but I liked it, especially the missi roti (chick pea bread). Also solid were the butter chicken and daal saag. I'd return!
author: Andrew K.

description: My friend wanted to go here and I must say I was dragging my feet trying to convince him otherwise. Boy am I glad I'm not such a great convincer because the food was really good. We got the samosa, chicken tikka masala and butter chicken masala. Everything was really good and the service was amazing. They were on top of their service. Their heat level was very low. We got the spicy and the guy kept warning us and asking are we sure. We got it and tried it we all agreed it was mild at best. Great food, amazing service!
author: Sarah T.

description:
We were very disappointed by the quality of the dining experience here, especially after seeing so many glowing reviews.  Just don't get it.  The food was very mediocre, not particularly well seasoned and very salty.

The prices were good for SF and the servers were friendly, but that's about it.

If you're in the neighborhood and craving Indian food, I would suggest nearby Dosa instead.
author: Jane D.

description: A-OK. I ordered delivery on the night of the Oscars, so I can't speak to the staff or ambiance. The food came way late, which was to be expected on that night. I give it 3 stars, because I ordered the dishes I would usually get at other Nepalese restaurants and in comparison they were tasteless.
author: Adriana A.

description:
Did take out from here last night. I had the Chicken Korma, basmati rice and naan bread. The Korma was delicious. I got it medium to mild spicy and although I could have done spicier I liked the mild kick with the sweet raisins. The chicken was dark meat and was moist and flavor full. The rice was good although I can't think of words to describe rice. I guess good is the best I can do.. The naan bread was different than any naan I have ever had. It was flat and sort of doughy. I thought it could have used some salt and overall was kind of tasteless although good when dipped in the sauce. 
As I sat there and waited from my order, the staff was very welcoming and offer a cup of chai that was very tasty and not overly sweet. 
If I am at a hotel near the Royal Indian I will definitely be back. My mouth is already watering for more Chicken Korma
author: Linda M.

description:
Awesome!!!  Great food, Great location and customer service.
I am a huge fan of indian food so when i saw a new one i had to try it. What's even better about this place is  that along with indian dishes it has small but  great selection of himalayan food (nepalese food). 
There are plenty of vegetarian and vegan options here.Its not that pricey and the food portion is just right. Will be taking my family and friends there next time.
author: Sub N.

description: This restaurant certainly earned its 5 star rating! We came in around 6pm on a Thursday and we're seated immediately. For starters, we ordered the samosas and vegetable momo. The samosas were incredibly flavorful and cooked to perfection. The momos had a nice mix of flavors and spicy sauce on the side. We also ordered vegetable tikka masala, which was creamy and full of vegetables. To finish the meal we got an order of garlic naan, which was fresh, warm and covered in delicious garlic. Will definitely return to try more of what the menu has to offer!
author: Mary S.

description: We haven't been in to the restaurant, but our delivery is always early, accurate, and delicious. Excellent amount of spice at every level (mild to very spicy) and large portions--one order of Naan is usually enough for two. The meat has always been good quality and I love their chutneys. Maybe the tastiest Indian food we've had the pleasure of ordering in the city (and with a health score rating that doesn't make me second guess my sanity!). Delivery guy is always pleasant to top it off.
author: P D.

description:
Nice and friendly service. 
Food is amazing - If you don't know about Indian food well, don't hesitate just ask them. They will explain all the details and find your perfect meals for you.
author: Soran R.

description:
Try this it's really delicious 
1. Chicken tikka masala
2. Chicken Momo
I expected my delivery for one hour but I got delivered hot by 30 minutes of my order, awesome!!!
author: Asif R.

description:
Three stars for the food but two for the biased experience we had the other night here.

We walked in around 6:30 and we were immediately seated at a small table for two. There were already two tables present there, a table of one and a table of two. They have around 10 tables, with two small ones. We got seated at one of those. Then three more tables of two came in and they seated at a the big ones, one of the three couples were even sat at a big table of six. 

At that moment I realized how biased my own people could be. Most of their customers are "American" and that is who they cater to. They are not very expensive with each dish priced at between ten to fifteen dollars. Our bill was sixty bucks. 

Just because of that I will not be back.
author: Lovejit K.

description:
This was a delivery through Yelp's Eat 24 app.

After a problem, the restaurant called me and very politely apologised and offered me a refund and explained it was an interim chef (I can believe it as i've had a good meal there before). A very good gesture. I've updated my review to 4 stars for that customer service. I will try them again next week and may completely re-write this review depending on how happy it makes my belly.
author: Mark T.

description:
This should be a place to go restaurant for the locals and visitors in the area. They changed the ambiance of previous establishment with upgrade in whatnot. Very comfortable seating arrangement and very homely service, not a foppy so-called professional palace service. 

The food is very flavorful with perfect texture of spices and ingredients. 

We tried 
Achare chicken - mouth watering taste
Aloo Gobi - very fresh
Butter Chicken- very rich
Chicken vindaloo - spicy tasty
Naans- hot and crispy
Cumin rice - aromic delight.

I already tried 2 times. I will definitely go back next time soon as it is my place to go restaurant.
author: Laxman A.

description: I love mutter/matar paneer. I've eaten it at many, many restaurants and often make it at home. Royal Indian Cuisine's matar paneer was a huge disappointment. I usually get medium but decided to go for mild, but the dish that I was served had not the slightest hint of a kick. In fact, it tasted like they'd forgotten spices in general. There was such a lack of flavor that it mostly tasted like peas and the oil in the paneer cubes (they were fried, which is a bit unusual in my experience). The consistency was more like soup. I ended up taking it home and adding a lot of chana masala and a bit of hot ground red pepper to make it enjoyable. The other things we ordered were okay, but not amazing, so I really don't understand how this place currently has 4.5 stars. Sadly, our experience was not worth the second dollar sign it cost.
author: Michelle G.

description:
Originally planned to go to DOSA but it was closed for lunch. That is when we decided to try out this little gem.

Interiors were nice and clean. We got the vegetarian thali which was basically a three course meal for two. It consisted of samosas for starter, followed by Saag paneer and Dal makhani served with butter naan and rice. I loved the kheer for desert. Would recommend. Also got sweet lassi which was ok.

Overall good service and solid food at a decent price point (under $50 for 2)
author: Nishith M.

description: Great Indian delivery! Order was right on time and cooked exactly how I asked. Love how they have 5 different spicyness levels for their food, I got the hottest and it was great. Also the side of garlic naan is a huge amount of naan. Not from SF but would definitely order again!
author: Ryan M.

description:
This in my new favorite Indian place! I live in the Richmond and Indian cuisine isn't very popular there, so my girlfriend and I went to try this newly renovated restaurant and we were impressed!
We had butter chicken and veggie biryani, our go-to Indian dishes, and both were cooked well and tasted delicious. The Naan was nice and soft but crispy on the edges like it should be. The ambience was also great as it was well decorated from inside, but I wish they had a more welcoming sign outside instead of the old one.
author: Abdul H.

description: Great food, good value for money, very friendly waiter....don't give this place a miss if you are in San Fran
author: Tony S.

description: Excellent malai kofta, great bread, and friendly service. I was dining alone, that night, and the staff didn't give me any attitude, or try to sit me at the worst table. I can't wait to go back to try other dishes!
author: Thomas D.

description:
We were very pleasantly surprised with the quality of food. The chicken was tender, the sauce was quite flavorful, and the naan was deliciously chewy. The rice was also done very well, and wasn't a distraction to the meal. The service is great, I was treated very warmly and when my initial order seemed to be less than ideal, it was promptly replaced. 

Be warned that the "mild" sauce is quite spicy, so unless you have a high tolerance, I wouldn't recommend anything spicier.

I am sure that the first order I had was a fluke. 5 stars all around.
author: James P.

description:
Ordered delivery because it was new and had good ratings. Naan was horrible and flat, more like roti. Chicken tikka masala had way too much cream and no flavor. The chicken momos were ok (but Red Chili is way better). The samosas were soggy. Lamb biryani was fine.
All of the chutneys were watered down. Super disappointing.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Another great Indian restaurant in San Francisco. I and my girlfriend went there for Friday night dinner. We only had to wait 15 mins. We ordered chicken momo which was juicy and delicious. Garlic naan was long and big, rice was okay. Chicken tikka masala was very flavorful and rich in taste. Welcoming customer service. Definitely recommend. Tried their delivery service fast,
Prompt and accurate.
author: Steve W.

description:
Everything was ok-ish, but had the slightly off flavors that commercially pre-prepared meals have, like Sukhi's gourmet meals. I was really tempted to walk into the kitchen and see whether they're using mostly brought-in pre-prepared food, or are actually making things from scratch. I have a strong suspicion that it's the former, though I have no concrete evidence. I wish I could be more positive because the staff was extremely nice and welcoming.

I lived in NYC (8 years) and near London (11 years), and while there were many mediocre Punjabi-centric restaurants in both cities, I've been to some truly extraordinary ones. Sadly, this restaurant is nowhere near a five-star experience.
author: Geoff S.

description: Great food, Delicious with full of flavors, atmosphere and ambience was wonderful!  The garlic nan is one of the best along with navratan Korma. Giving only 4 stars since the service was very slow, not sure if it was because of Thanksgiving day. But overall a great restaraunt. The nans are bigger than other places and momos is a must try.
author: pallavi g.

description: Went here excited for a new location that opened up in the neighborhood poor service , cold papadum and we didn't even get our beer when complaint the waiter dint even say sorry I would not recommend this place to anyone ironically I am indian and felt that the service was marginalized
author: C D.

description: Coming in, I was wondering how can a place have so many 5 stars. Am now convinced that this places deserves it's unanimous MVP rating. Tried the momos, dal soup, navratan korma, baingan bartha, missi roti, pudina parata, and lacha parata. Service is excellent.
author: Karthik G.

description: Went for a business dinner meal and everything we ordered was to our liking! Chicken Tandoori, Lamb Vindaloo, vegetable salad, samosas, and rice/naan were all cooked perfectly and order accuracy was impressive! We were delighted with the food taste and variety of options which satisfied our entire party's appetite! If you're looking for a warm and inviting atmosphere to enjoy some Indian cuisine, this place will meet your needs!
author: Abel G.

description: Nicely decorated. Tandoori chicken was flavorful and fresh. Samosa and Chana-pretty good. Can't say the same for the basmati rice as it had a funny taste. Not a big deal as it was just a side order of white rice.
author: Betty D.

description: What more do you want? Fairly cheap, food comes out fast, great service and consistently delicious! A++
author: James A.

description:
Ordered for delivery based upon the reviews but food was just not worth the wait...

Tandoori chicken came covered in sauce - in other words 'wet' and covered with cooked onions, etc. Great for a stewed chicken but not what I expected - and of course it was not 'spicy' as I had requested...

Lamb biryani was dry, and seasoned with cloves... Let me tell you, after crunching down on a couple of those you get very timid about your next bite! The dish had the appearance of having been thrown together from just rice and some precooked lamb pieces, not prepared together.

I picked up some seasoned rice that was better. A small portion of cumin and turmeric seasoned basmati - not exactly the typical saffron rice one might be used to.

I tried a couple of breads - paratha and a buttered naan that were nice. But the order did not include the advertised "2 free papadums"...

Overall I'd rather drive to Pakwan in the Tenderloin for a more authentic and satisfying meal. Not going to order from these guys again...
author: Leake L.

description: I eat here regularly because I live in the neighborhood. It's pretty decent. The only thing I don't like about this place is the inconsistency with the spicy-ness level. I had a different server than usual today and the food came out not spicy at all. I was super disappointed about this because I love spicy food. It is half the reason why I went here today. But the food came waaaay below what I'd even consider "mild". In the past I've asked for spicy, medium spicy, very spicy etc ... sometimes you get what you ask for sometimes it's the least spicy Indian food you've ever had :(. Such a bummer.
author: Uriae W.

description: Samosa are bomb!! Curries bomb!! Lamb is bomb! I'm from hawaii and we only have one good Indian restaurant so while we were in SF it was on my priority list to get good Indian food and this place definitely hit the spot.
author: Mikela B.

description: Amazing Indian food with free delivery! Have eaten here at least 5 times, trying different dishes, and never had a dish I didn't like. Keep the great food coming!
author: Marina R.

description:
This place is a hidden gem.  I live a half a block away and this somehow flew under my radar for two years.  So happy we found it.  

The food is simply great.  The vegetable momas and any type of vindaloo are incredibly flavorful.  

Bonus: we can get takeout - 2 entrees and an appetizer for less than $40.  

Hope this place never leaves.
author: Shawn C.

description:
This is tooo good taste 

I like momos they r to good and stuff inside momo r perfect 

And the chicken tandoori mix is good every piece is like well marinated 

The chef is too good in presentation of dish and flavors are so perfect and mild 


to good 

This is for chef ‍
author: Kunal G.

description: Yummy food. I do miss the buffet that was here before but I love the food at this place more. The baighan bharta (eggplant) dish, the chicken curry and the saag paneer were delicious and perfectly seasoned. Loved the garlic naan as well. One of the best Indian places that I've been too.
author: Reena P.

description: This place is under new management.  It does not have the buffet anymore but they really beautified the establishment with new chairs and decor..  Its really nice and intimate. My wife and i ordered the butter chicken masala and vegetarian mushroom Matar. It was perfectly cooked fresh.  It was not too spicy and the sauce was savory with sweet tomatoe undertones... Kabuli naan was pretty good too.
author: Allen W.

description:
Highly recommended
- Great vegan options. If it's not a default vegan dish, chances are they're glad to make it vegan for you. Which leads me to...
- Very nice crew. I've been twice now with friends and they remembered us. Both times we felt super welcome. Patient when going through the menu and helpful when trying to understand options.
- Super reasonable pricing, even with wine.
- Spice level is 

Just go.
author: Mike D.

description: The first thing we loved about this place was good and kind service. The restaurant was in quite place though in the middle of busy downtown. A cool place to hang out with friends. Food was satisfactory too and in reasonable price.
author: Subai T.

description: Don't look any further if you want quality Indian food! This place is definitely the best Indian cuisine in SF and I'm very picky when it comes to Indian food. I have it delivered through Eat24 at least once every couple weeks and they never disappoint. Keep up the great work over there and thank you for always being consistent.
author: John G.

description: I really wanted to like this place, but was disappointed in the food. Coconut chicken and tikka masala were both average. Saag paneer was the best of the three. Little Delhi, which is now temporarily closed has much much better food.
author: Q Q.

description:
The best Indian restaurant we'hv ever been to , great service and the food was to delicious chicken tika masala , garlic bread, chicken momo were the best we'hv 
Definitely be back 
Thank you
author: Bharat C.

description: Had a lot of Indian food. This is the best. The malai kofta and kabuli naan are particularly delicious, as is the kebab.
author: Lane E.

description: Good service and overall atmosphere of the restaurant. I ordered the Chicken Saag in mild spiciness and it was delicious, but it was much spicier than what I wanted to order.
author: Vivian C.

description: I love this place. Been here multiple times for takeout and they never fail to impress! The portions are big, prices are right, and food is delicious! I love their chicken korma the most, it's so sweet and savory. I have tried a bunch of their other dishes and each time I want to come back again. I've been trying to find a good Indian restaurant for a long long time and I finally found my go to spot!!!
author: Jennifer T.

description: Another great place for Indian food "Royal Indian cuisine" located exactly at Fillmore st between post st and sutter st has won my heart with its great taste and rich flavors. Lamb Rogan josh, Serrano naan, Jeera rice, with a glass of red wine. Perfect evening. Prices are ok, service is swift. I'll go again. Thank you Royal.
author: Feroz C.

description: Delicious....chichen curry was tender, aromatic and spicy. Appetizers were scrumptious. Will be going back. Thankyou for opening up a new indian restaurant in auburn.
author: Allison P.

description: So awesome to live close to this place! The garlic naan and butter chicken masala are really good. The renovation this place just completed under new management makes for a brighter experience that is a step above the previous buffet style that it replaced. Highly recommended.
author: Brian R.

description: Took my parents to this place. The food tasted really good but the quantity was a bit less.
author: Suhani N.

description: Our new favorite Indian food spot! So delicious, good flavor, unique dishes, and well made classics. My usual spot Aroma in Benicia CA has competition here in SF! Highly recommended. The staff was friendly, attentive, and answered all my questions.
author: Chris O.

description:
My family and I were supposed to dine in at Curry Leaf on Columbus because it has high reviews but when we got there the wait was long and it was getting late for dinner.

I searched for another Indian restaurant and came across Royal Indian Cuisine along Fillmore street with 5 stars review. I called the place and the person who answered was very friendly and told me that they have table available. 

 When we got there, there were 2 people ahead of us. When the table for 6 became available they offered us if we don't mind to sit with the 2 people ahead of us but we decided to wait for a different table. 

When we got seated we placed our order (chicken tandoori and lamb biryani and samosa for appetizer). Omg, their food is very good. The staff are very friendly and we didn't wait that very long for our food to be served. I highly recommend this  restaurant if you're in the mood for Indian, Himalayan and Nepalese cuisine. 

We will definitely come back to this place next we visit San Francisco.
author: Thea G.

description: The menu has most of the Indian restaurant food you may expect. But I have to say, it was WAY MORE TASTY than I expected. And at great prices, too. Feels like a really good neighborhood restaurant. Friendly service as well.
author: Andrew L.

description: Just on a weekend getaway from LA, loved the food in this small, quaint Indian Restaurant. All the dishes were tasty, well prepared. Good attentive service. Ambiance is cozy. Will come back when we come back for another getaway to SF.
author: Katherine D.

description: Possibly best Indian food I've ever had. Inexpensive for anywhere but especially for San Francisco, fast service. I had samosas, lamb curry, and chicken korma, and all were perfect. The lamb was so tender I could smash it with a fork with no effort.
author: Dan L.

description: A good place to grab food. It can get really spicy !  Me and my wife love it! Definitely, we recommend this place!
author: Sergio R.

description: Value for money and many choices on the menu. While food is not wow, its not bad for what you pay. I loved their naan and dal makhni which was above average
author: Abinash S.

description: I cannot say enough good things about Royal. My boyfriend and I came in last night (no reservations) and had a 5 star experience. The service was great, the people were lovely, and the food was AMAZING. I've lived in the city about a year and this is by far the best Indian food I've had - way better than Dosa and at a fraction of the price. Definitely will be back - found my new favorite SF restaurant. Do yourself a favor and go!
author: Heather F.

description: First time ordering from this place and we are just simply impressed with not only the awesome food but the quick delivery as well. We ordered the chicken tikka masala, vegan vegetable curry, rice, garlic naan, and last but not least the vegetable momos(dumplings filled w/love) all of which arrived hot! Will definitely order again! Momos all day everyday...
author: Ray N.

description: I ordered delivery tonight -- chicken tikka masala, aloo gobi, plain naan and rice. The food was fresh and tasty. I will definitely order from this place again!
author: Esther L.

description: Really clean and bright atmosphere when you walk in. The staff is super nice and the food is amazing. Their mango lassi's are delicious and the chicken tikka masala is to die for. It's a perfect location on Fillmore. Definitely a place I will come back to.
author: Leah N.

description: You step in the door and you are met with the smell of wonderful spices and herbs. You are immediately hungry and excited all at once. The servers are gracious and attentive. The white table cloth and nice portions are perfect for a meal. The curry I ordered was flavorful and creamy. Perfect. Considering what you get for the price, it's fantastic.
author: Matt G.

description:
When looking for a place to eat before show at the Fillmore we saw that this place had five stars. And it earned its five stars! 

We ordered the chicken tikka masala and the tandoori chicken. You do have to order rice and naan separately, but the prices are very reasonable. The chicken tikka masala had a  deliciously creamy sauce. The tandoori chicken arrived sizzling on a cast iron plate and stayed warm throughout the meal. The ambiance feels like you are at a dinner party in someone's living room, and the service was perfectly attentive. We will be back for more!
author: Amy K.

description: Decided to try this place out because I was craving some good Indian food.some Indian friends recommended this place and I was more then pleasad.amazing food,great service,definitely we will be back.
author: Somnath R.

description: Split the Vegetarian Thali for 2 with a side of chicken biryani. Of the 5 Indian places in the city I've tried it has been by far the best. Ordering our meal "spicy" actually resulted in spicy food. The daal makhani and the biryani were standout. It's not the best I've ever had, but the the best I've had in SF. Will definitely return.
author: R M.

description: Food was above average but service was really bad. I went there with my friend, we were having such a good time and thn this Indian lady comes to take our order with really bad attitude. I think she was having a horrible day but it spoiled our mood. And her attitude was like that for the entire time we were there. Other employees were good. But I AM NOT GOING THERE AGAIN.
author: Rush S.

description: We visited Royal Indian Cuisine when we came to San Fran to catch a show at the Fillmore, just a few blocks away. We enjoyed our meal.
author: Tami S.

description: Excellent food.  Nice restaurant and clean.  The coconut naan bread was so good.  Definitely want to return.
author: Barbara H.

description: I and a group of friends visited here on a Sunday afternoon. It was well occupied but I didn't feel crowded & service was quick. We ordered a chicken tikka masala, saag paneer over rice, and I was immensely satisfied after my meal. The menu was thorough, and I plan to venture back soon to explore more of their curries. Ooh, and the samosas at a nearby table caught my eye.
author: Jake P.

description: Excellent food and service. We ordered 8 different items and everything was fantastic. The tandoori chicken was tasty and moist. The chai tea is also recommended.
author: Elaine S.
