description: Just ordered delivery from here for the first time last night. Everything we ordered was spot on. Not the best I've ever had but the best I've had in SF for a long time. Delivery was on time, all there and well organized.
author: Daniel E.

description: This is just for the chicken momos! 4.5 *s Went for a solo lunch in the city, being Nepali myself was craving some momos and figured would check this new place out! Served in bamboo containers, the Momo was delicious and the sauce was authentic! Was hoping for greasiness that tends to be the case with most momos in the Bay Area but was delighted that it was light and fresh. Will be back :)
author: Mo S.

description: Probably the best place to eat at san Francisco.  Wish they were in new york or jersey!
author: Rahul S.

description: Two stars for a nice atmosphere and decent service however the food here is just not good at all. Their naan is literally flour and tastes terrible and their tikka masala was extremely bland. Their shrimp bryani was extremely wet and wasn't great. Honestly overall, this was the worst indian food I've ever had. Please keep in mind however that I have many close india friends who take me to really good indian food in San Jose so I am an indian food snob but this place is really just subpar.
author: Nicole N.

description: The Indian food is good here and not spiced up to the point of fiery heartburn-inducing unkind. The waiters were very attentive and I enjoyed all the dishes we ordered. We got free chai refills (I think) and a free dessert. I've never had Indian-style dumplings (momo?) but they were quite tasty and a must order. This place was packed on a Sunday night.
author: W A.

description: Great food, friendly service. It is tasty, I am a vegetarian, and they have a lot of vegetarian options, and a few vegan options.
author: Uka U.

description: Really good. Best Indian I've had in a while. Friendly service, nice ambiance. Skip dosa-come here!
author: Reham A.

description: I went here for the first time with a party of 10 and the staff was really great! It was a seamless experience and the food was fresh and hot. The restaurant did a really great job catering our needs! Definitely one of the better Indian restaurants in the city!
author: Manvi G.

description: Okra and naan were amazing. Tikka masala, baingan bharta and malai kofta were mediocre. Too creamy for me. Would definitely come back for the okra though!
author: Kendy L.

description: The Royal Thali dinner was a fantastic deal and filled us up with leftovers for tomorrow. The variety of this dinner for 2 was great:  tikka masala was extremely flavorful as was the rice pudding. Fluffy naan, great service and no wait. We will definitely be back!
author: Abby B.

description: It's is one of the best restaurant in town I was there last night chicken saag , butter chicken veg & naan was amazing they did add acid in food .
author: Jigna P.

description: Best indian food so far ! Food is delicious not too heavy and service is awesome ! Definitely will come back
author: Ko O.

description: Great deal for this neighborhood. Nice place for a Friday night dinner. Excellent service, nice relaxed atmosphere. And overall good food.
author: Sara A.

description: We had the pleasure of eating at royal indian cuisine a few weeks ago and I wanted to review it immediately but life got in the way! I  can not say enough good things about this little restaurant. We will be regulars once back home in SF. Being vegetarians we eat Indian food all over the world and Royal Indian Cuisine is our new favorite.The naan is amazing, Saag Paneer was fantastic and the other dishes were all delicious, not greasy as a lot of Indian food can be and perfectly spiced. AJ the owner was so warm and welcoming. He introduced himself and made us feel like we had been valued customers for years instead of walk ins. You can have your fancy trendy places for party nights,but if you want a delicious meal with an intimate atmosphere where you can hear the people you are dining with, this should be your go to restaurant.
author: D C A.

description: Butter chicken and Kadai chicken are delicious! Ordered them twice and they were good both times. Good delivery service, once they reached early! 5/5
author: Thejas K.

description: This place is amazing!! Excellent service, the staff are so friendly. Very clean. The food is fantastic - their tikka masala is the perfect comfort food!!
author: Mollie M.

description: This is my first time writing a review and that shows how good this place is. Great prices and large portions. Hands down the best restaurant in San Francisco. Not just the best Indian restaurant. The best restaurant.
author: Eric F.

description: Absolutely love this place. Have been coming once a week since they opened and their chicken tandoori is the best I have ever had. Friendly people and overall a great find!
author: Alexis B.

description:
Live around the corner from this spot.After new renovation Me and my friend went there last night  for dinner. Seriously delicious .we order bunch of stop. Chicken tikka masala samosa garlic naan basmati rice. Seriously delicious yummy food great services. I wish this restaurant will Seattle  so I could eat here regularly !!!!
Thank you Royal Indian cuisine for delicious food we will see again
author: Khem G.

description: My husband and I order from this incredibly delicious restaurant almost every week, and we could not be more pleased.  Everything we've ordered from this establishment has been flavorful, and I enjoy that we can choose the spice levels since I prefer more kick.  We've been trying all their tasty breads and have successfully discovered our favorite in the keema naan.  The chicken tikka masala is extraordinary, filled with large chunks of white meat chicken garnished with a rich spicy sauce.  Kudos to the chicken curry as and lamb korma as well!  Portions are generous, so we are able to have two meals from one delivery.  All the staff are dependable and courteous, and delivery is prompt.  Our favorite Indian restaurant!
author: Laurie W.

description: It takes a lot to get me to review, and this place KILLED IT! We ordered vegetable pankora for an app, chicken tikka massla and chicken vindaloo for entries and we couldn't be more impressed. Add this to fantastic service you got one of the best Indian spots around. Check it out
author: Matthew T.

description: The food was EXCELLENT ...we got exactly what we ordered....and very quickly.  Easy online ordering too. One tip...we ordered to our hotel room and they didn't include cutlery or plates. We were at a loss when the (motel) couldn't help either.  We had to call back and wait for them to come back with utensils.
author: Joanne D.

description: Great little Indian place with tasty curries and good naans. Service can be a bit slow but if you're not in a rush then this is a good spot.
author: Hannah D.

description: Excellent food. Excellent service. That's all that needs to be said! It's a quaint little restaurant in the middle of a quaint little neighborhood.
author: Michael R.

description:
there's just something about this place, we came here on a busy saturday noon, ample parking available all around, an aquarium to visit after 

food is so good, so is the service and worth every dollar!
author: Awani M.

description: Good food. I ordered the Chicken tikka masala and was content with the amount of meat. The sauce was also sweet.
author: Robert A.

description: Wow, what a find. My daughter lives on this block, and my husband and I stopped in for a mid afternoon dinner/lunch. Unbelievable. I knew it was under new management..you really need to try this place. I ordered a glass of wine and got an incredibly generous pour of a sauvignon blanc. The chicken korma was beyond, and the garlic naan was so fresh and hot we wanted a second one. My husband loves okra so we had the masala bhindi and it made me an okra fan. They start with papadam and chutnies, and the Samosa was piping hot and good also. We'll be back for sure.
author: Lisa M B.

description: i had a good experience in this new indian restaurant. the food was tasty, fresh and great value of price , service was excellet.i highly recommend to dine here once. thanks to the royal family
author: Sha C R.

description: I used to come here all the time before the remodel/new ownership, even though I didn't live in SF.  I moved down the street, and really wanted the great quality quick buffet, I remembered, so fondly.  It looked scratchy but the food was amazing for the price.  I'm pretty sad, that not only is that no longer available, but the prices have dramatically increased.  Now it's just like any other mainstream Indian Restaurant, and I'm not impressed.  The chickpea nan sounded awesome.  It was dry, and hard to eat, even after dipped in the curry.  Lamb Saag was just okay.  Lower Pac Heights prices, but average food.  I'll be pursuing new Indian locations, that have food that is worth the pricing.  I gave what was left, to a homeless guy around the corner, so it would go to someone, who would actually eat the leftovers.
author: Kitty B.

description: Recently opened Restaurant at Fillmore! Really surprised to taste an extra flavor of food which has awesome taste! Naturally yummy, of course once is not enough!  Thank you Royal Indian, You are the best!
author: Bhuwan A.

description: I wasn't going to leave a review since this place is new, but the food destroyed my stomach, and not in the good way that Indian food normally destroys one's stomach. The food was meh. Entirely possible I just had a bad experience and this place is in fact excellent. Just avoid the chicken vindaloo perhaps.
author: B H.

description: This place is fantastic. I live in the neighborhood and it's my new go-to Indian place. Love it, and the servers/staff are very nice too!
author: M J.

description: Food was ok but we had to wait over an hour to be seated and given our food. It surprised me because it was 8:40 at night. I will not come back because they also took 18 percent gratuity which was unfair since they took so long to bring the food.
author: Tanvi W.

description: Ordered delivery. They were quicker than estimated so that's a plus but the food was really mediocre. Everything was very bland or super spicy. The egg fried rice was incredibly dry. I gave this place a try based on all the good yelp reviews but prob won't be going back.
author: Saikat P.

description: Delicious! Good service. Recently reopened and is excellent. If you ask for spicy you will get it.
author: Joel B.

description: Live in the neighborhood and pass this place frequently.  With all the restaurants on Fillmore, I just never got around to trying it.  My loss.  Finally went for the first time today.  Charming decor and pleasant ambiance, very attractive table service.  My companion, a vegetarian, had quite a long selection of vegetarian dishes to choose from.  He ordered samosas and the vegetable momo, a Nepali dish very like light steamed dumplings.  He loved the spice combinations in both the samosa filling and the momo.  I ordered the vegetable soup and the Kashmiri chicken.  The soup was spicy and very tasty.  Since I hadn't been here before, I decided discretion was the better part of valor and ordered the spice level on the chicken "mild."  It was a delicious  dish but even for my timid taste buds it could have been spicier.  Will definitely ordered "medium" spicy next time and there certainly will be a next time.  For me the servings were generous and I took about half the chicken dish home in a box.  One caveat, service was slow.  We were in no hurry and felt the dishes were prepared to order and not just dished up from a steam table.  Therefore, it was worth the wait.
author: Claire L.

description: Was conflicted between giving 4 or 5 stars, and perhaps we can chalk this up to my low expectations when I ordered, I am going to be generous. Saffron Grill has gone downhill these days, it used to be my go to place. So I was really hoping for a new place to pop up, but anytime you see a crazy number of 5-star reviews by a predominantly newbie crowd, you tend to be suspicious, as I was. But the chicken tikka masala was pretty decent, the bhindi masala good, and the saag paneer passed my wife's saag paneer test. Don't get me wrong, I am grading on a curve here..but expectations exceeded, so will order again. If the quality drops, I reserve the right to reconsider my generosity.
author: Gibu T.

description: Tried this place on a recommendation fob my optometrist a block away.  Used to be a buffet which I never would eat at. The new ownership is the best thing as the  improvement of white table cloths,  great service & most importantly the food is good! Service was  gracious and attentive.  I wish them the best.  SF can always use more great Indian cuisine. I'll be back!
author: Graciela P.

description: I will give it  4 stars,since taken over they got rid of Bollywood tv,which is good,they still play indian music which is not too bad,the service was quick and friendly,i got lamb biryani  I would have liked it a bit less spicey,i asked for it mild,the lamb was nice but they could have had some more pieces,the biryani was a bit wet,im used to England biryani were it more dry,i would probably avoid it next time as they make it very sweet,i might buy it and share it but would not buy it on my own,prices seem very high,not as high the place down the road but still high,plain nan bread was big and nice its called butter nan,they gave out a free popodom at start,it was busy and people seemed to enjoy the meals,iwould go back but probably not for biryani
author: cc c.

description: Ordered delivery - service was quick, food was delicious, and the spice level was perfect!
author: Emily D.

description: This is the best Indian food in the world. I have no complaints. The naan is amazing and they are super friendly.
author: Ethan N.

description: What a wonderful surprise.....there was another Indian restaurant here but when we thought we were going to that one we walked into Royal Indian and immediately knew it was different and much more attractive. The food was really really good and the service very pleasant and timely. The tandoori shrimp was the best I have had, even in England. Can't recommend this place enough......try it you won't be sorry.
author: Barbara D.
